intro: Vicoa gokhalei, commonly known as the Gokhale's vicoa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded undergrowth, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are elliptical with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native region.
